comments.body:
We need a unit test case to validate the logic here in listing multiple taskStatus values.  For example, a REST API call to show all the FAILED tasks and KILLED tasks :
/application/{app-id}/stages?details=true&taskStatus=FAILED&taskStatus=KILLED
Do we still need a simple test here?

change the default value to 0.0,0.25,0.5,0.75,1.0.  In a parallel system, the duration of a stage is often determined by the slowest task/executor.  To monitor/debug a skew issue, the maximal value (or 100% percentile value) is more useful than the 95% percentile value.

> change the default value to 0.0,0.25,0.5,0.75,1.0. In a parallel system, the duration of a stage is often determined by the slowest task/executor. To monitor/debug a skew issue, the maximal value (or 100% percentile value) is more useful than the 95% percentile value.

Add this value since 
https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/f54d430c536bfb4731401868960d6e35ddd089ea/core/src/main/scala/org/apache/spark/status/api/v1/StagesResource.scala#L72-L78

Similar API need keep consistent too....
I see.  You want to keep it consistent.

> I see. You want to keep it consistent.

Emmmm, I found that in ui and restful API the quantiles is not same....
